title: Cantal
text:
Ingredients
Yield: 2 pounds


9L full cream pasteuirzed milk
1/4 t of Mesophilic Culture, or 4 T mesophilic mother culture
2.5ml (1/2 t) liquid rennet in 1/4 cup non-chlorinated water (or 1/4 rennet table)
2 T kosher salt
cheese mold
cheese cloth
cheese box
colander
large bowl for whey
large bowl for mixing in salt
weights

title: Cantal
text:
Heat milk to (30C)

1/4 t of Mesophilic Culture, or 4 T mesophilic mother culture
prepare 2.5ml (1/2 t) liquid rennet in 1/4 cup non-chlorinated water

title: Cantal
section: Sprinkle on mesophilic culture, leave for 2 mins
text: Sprinkle on mesophilic culture, leave for 2 mins

title: Cantal
section: Stir, cover, and ripen for 15 mins at 30C
text: Stir, cover, and ripen for 15 mins at 30C

title: Cantal
section: Add rennet and stir for 1 minute
text: Add rennet and stir for 1 minute

title: Cantal
section: Cover, and keep at 30C for 1 hour or until clean break
text: Cover, and keep at 30C for 1 hour or until clean break

title: Cantal
text:
Cut curds into 1/4 inch cubes

Use a wisk to cut pieces you miss

title: Cantal
text: Let sit (covered) for 5 mins

title: Cantal
section: Pour curds and whey through a cheese cloth lined colander
text:
Pour curds and whey through a cheese cloth lined colander

keep warm while it drain (about 20 mins)

title: Cantal
section: Break curds into several pieces and put into a cheese basket lined with cheese cloth
text: Break curds into several pieces and put into a cheese basket lined with cheese cloth

title: Cantal
text: Press at 2.4-4.5kg for 12 hours

title: Cantal
section: Flip and press for 12 more hours
text:
Flip and press for 12 more hours

at same weight (2.4-4.5kg).

title: Cantal
section: In a large bowl, mill (break up) the cheese into 1-inch pieces.
text: In a large bowl, mill (break up) the cheese into 1-inch pieces.

title: Cantal
section: Add 2 T kosher salt and mix well
text:
Add 2 T kosher salt and mix well

knead with your fingers

title: Cantal
text: Rinse the mold and cloth

title: Cantal
section: Place the cheese in the mold lined with cloth
text: Place the cheese in the mold lined with cloth

title: Cantal
text:
Press at 10-20kg for 2-3 days

flipping every day

title: Cantal
section: Remove and let air-try at room temp for 2-3 days
text:
Remove and let air-try at room temp for 2-3 days

flipping every 6 hours

title: Cantal
text:
When dry to touch

Age at 10-13C and 80-85%RH for 3-6 months.
flip the cheese and wipe the rind with brine twice a week

title: Belper Knolle
text:
Ingredients


4L full cream pasteuirzed milk
1/8 t of Flora Danica (aromatic mesophilic culture) or Sacco MO36R
0.75ml (1/8 t) calcium chloride in 1/4 cup non-chlorinated water
6 drops single strength linquid rennet in 1 T of non-chlorinated water (standard dose?)
3 T kosher salt
3 cloves garlic
3 T black peppercorns
cheese box
colander
tight weave cheese cloth (for hanging)
loose weave cheese cloth (for keeping off insects)
large bowl for whey
large bowl for mixing in salt
rope to hang with

title: Belper Knolle
section: if using a tablet rennet, dissolve it in the water
text: if using a tablet rennet, dissolve it in the water

title: Belper Knolle
text: remove starter culture from freezer

title: Belper Knolle
text:
Put milk on the heat

target is 30C

title: Belper Knolle
section: whisk / stir the cream through the milk
text: whisk / stir the cream through the milk

title: Belper Knolle
text:
Add calcium chloride

0.75ml in 1/4 cup

title: Belper Knolle
text: Heat milk to 30C

title: Belper Knolle
section: Sprinkle over freeze dried starter culture
text: Sprinkle over freeze dried starter culture

title: Belper Knolle
text: wait 5 mins

title: Belper Knolle
text:
stir in the starter culture

can use kefir? try a few T

title: Belper Knolle
section: add rennet and stir for 1 mins
text: add rennet and stir for 1 mins

title: Belper Knolle
section: cover and let set for 12-18 hours
text:
cover and let set for 12-18 hours

it is ready when the curds come away from the edge of the pot and there is a thin layer of whey on top of the curds.

title: Belper Knolle
section: line a colander with cheese cloth and ladel the curds into it
text: line a colander with cheese cloth and ladel the curds into it

title: Belper Knolle
section: tie the cheese cloth together and hang over a pot
text: tie the cheese cloth together and hang over a pot

title: Belper Knolle
text: hang for 18 hours

title: Belper Knolle
section: move the cheese to a bowl
text: move the cheese to a bowl

title: Belper Knolle
text:
break the cheese apart

check for firmness

title: Belper Knolle
text:
add to mortar and pestle:

3 garlic cloves chopped
1.5t of salt

title: Belper Knolle
text: grind to a smooth paste

title: Belper Knolle
section: mix the paste through the cheese
text: mix the paste through the cheese

title: Belper Knolle
text:
add salt to taste

0.5 t at a time

title: Belper Knolle
section: put in the fridge and set a timer for 30mins
text:
put in the fridge and set a timer for 30mins

this is to help it firm up

title: Belper Knolle
section: wash and dry pestle and mortar
text: wash and dry pestle and mortar

title: Belper Knolle
section: toast the peppercorns until they change colour
text:
toast the peppercorns until they change colour

should take around 2 mins

title: Belper Knolle
section: add to mortar and pestel and grind to medium fine
text: add to mortar and pestel and grind to medium fine

title: Belper Knolle
section: after 30 mins, shape the cheese into 5 even balls
text:
after 30 mins, shape the cheese into 5 even balls

slightly smaller than the size of a tennise ball

title: Belper Knolle
section: get a cheese box and bamboo mat sterilised and ready to go
text: get a cheese box and bamboo mat sterilised and ready to go

title: Belper Knolle
section: put the pepper on a dinner plate
text:
put the pepper on a dinner plate

start with half so you can more evenly distribute the pepper

title: Belper Knolle
section: roll the cheese balls in the pepper and place in the cheese box
text: roll the cheese balls in the pepper and place in the cheese box

title: Belper Knolle
section: cover the cheese box with cheese cloth
text:
cover the cheese box with cheese cloth

put near a fan to help air flow

title: Belper Knolle
section: air dry at room temp for 2 days
text:
air dry at room temp for 2 days

turn every 6 hours
they will get lighter in colour
may take less in hot weather

title: Belper Knolle
text:
put into cheese cave

add silica gell to keep the environment drier

title: Belper Knolle
text: leave for 4-6 weeks?

title: Belper Knolle
text:
resources

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-tuSxGcK1GI
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AGo0746S1X8&t=301s

title: About
text: About this site

title: Cheese-recipes
text:
Gruyere
Cantal
Gouda
Saturated Brine Solution
Belper Knolle

title: Gouda
text:
Ingredients

8L full cream milk
culture:

1/8th t (dash) of Thermophilic Culture
or 90ml active kefir

2ml (1/4 t) calcium chloride in 60ml cup non-chlorinated water
double dose of rennet
salt
wire whisk
ladle
container for whey
colander
bamboo mat for drying

title: Gouda
text:
Ingredients (3L version)

3L full creatm non-homogenised milke
or 40ml active kefir
0.75ml calcium chloride in 30ml cup non-chlorinated water
double dose of rennet
salt
wire whisk
ladle
container for whey
colander
bamboo mat for drying

title: Gouda
text: remove freezer Ingredients

title: Gouda
text:
heat milk to 32C

dissolve rennet tablets in water (double dose according to packet)
prepare calcium chloride (2ml in 60ml, or 0.78 in 30ml for 3L)

title: Gouda
text:
add culture

sprinkle culture on top of milk and let stand for 5 mins
mix the kefir (or yoghurt) with some of the milk, then mix into all of it

title: Gouda
text: stir in the culture

title: Gouda
text:
stir in calcium chloride

2ml in 60ml water
or, 0.75ml in 60ml for 3L

title: Gouda
section: add rennet and stir for 1 minutes
text: add rennet and stir for 1 minutes

title: Gouda
section: cover and set for 1 hour at 32C
text: cover and set for 1 hour at 32C

title: Gouda
text: Stir in rennet for 1 minute

title: Gouda
text:
incubate for 1 hour

or until clean break

title: Gouda
section: cut the curds to size of lentil
text:
cut the curds to size of lentil

wisk like crazy with a wire whisk for 1-2 mins
stir the curds to check that there are no large pieces

title: Gouda
section: cook the curds to 43C while stiring
text:
cook the curds to 43C while stiring

do this for 30-60 mins, or,
until they bounce back when pressed between fingers

title: Gouda
section: allow curds to settle for 5 mins
text: allow curds to settle for 5 mins

title: Gouda
text:
pour off the whey

save 1L for washing brine

title: Gouda
section: put the curds into cheese basket
text:
put the curds into cheese basket
â€“ press lightly (5kg?) for 5 mins

title: Gouda
text:
make the washing brine

1T (15ml) salt in 1L of warm whey
refrigerate

title: Gouda
section: flip the cheese, rewrap and press a little harder
text:
flip the cheese, rewrap and press a little harder

do this every 10 mins for the next hour

title: Gouda
text: let air dry overnight

title: Gouda
text:
surface salt the cheese

1T (15ml) for 4L of milk (Asher)
2t (10ml) for 8L of salt on the top

stand at room temp for 24 hours

flip and thing rub in another 2t on the other side
stand at room temp for another 24 hours

title: Gouda
section: air dry flipping every so often until there is no visible moisture
text: air dry flipping every so often until there is no visible moisture

title: Gouda
text:
place in cheese cave

16C, 85% RH

title: Saturated Brine Solution
text:
Ingredients


1 fresh raw egg (for testing density)
2L non-chlorinated water
450g non-iodised salt (225g/L)
2T white vinegar (I assume normal strength)
1t (5ml) calcium chloride solution

title: Saturated Brine Solution
section: Put the water into a saucepan
text:
Put the water into a saucepan

can warm the water to help the salt disolve

title: Saturated Brine Solution
text: Add the egg

title: Saturated Brine Solution
section: Add the salt (non-iodised) until the egg floats
text:
Add the salt (non-iodised) until the egg floats

Add more salt if you want it more salty

title: Saturated Brine Solution
section: move the brine to a container and allow to cool
text:
move the brine to a container and allow to cool

get out the calcium chloride, vinegar, teaspoon, and tablespoon

title: Saturated Brine Solution
text: Stir in 1t calcium chloride (5ml)

title: Saturated Brine Solution
text: Stir in 2T vinegar

title: Saturated Brine Solution
section: Store in cheese cave or fridge
text: Store in cheese cave or fridge

title: Gouda
text:
Ingredients

10L full cream milk
1/8th t (dash) of Mesophilic Culture (MO30)
2.5ml (1/2 t) calcium chloride in 1/4 cup non-chlorinated water
2.5ml (1/2 t) liquid rennet in 1/4 cup non-chlorinated water
Saturated Brine Solution

calcium chloride
salt

cheese wax or vacumme bag
ladle
container for whey
seive
bamboo mat for drying

title: Gouda
text:
Put milk on the heat (29C)

measure 1/8th t (dash) of Mesophilic Culture (MO30)
prepare 2.5ml (1/2 t) calcium chloride in 1/4 cup non-chlorinated water
prepare 2.5ml (1/2 t) liquid rennet in 1/4 cup non-chlorinated water

title: Gouda
text:
Add mesophilic culture

also add a little kifir

title: Gouda
section: Let it sit for a couple mins then stir in
text: Let it sit for a couple mins then stir in

title: Gouda
text:
Stir calcium chloride

If using unpasturised milk
2.5ml (1/2 t) calcium chloride in 1/4 cup non-chlorinated water

title: Gouda
text:
Add rennet

2.5ml (1/2 t) liquid rennet in 1/4 cup non-chlorinated water
stir no more than 1min

title: Gouda
section: Let sit until clean break (30-40 mins)
text:
Let sit until clean break (30-40 mins)

mine took 1h15mins

title: Gouda
section: Cut curds into half inch cubes
text: Cut curds into half inch cubes

title: Gouda
text:
Let sit (covered) for 5 mins

prepare some non-chlorinated water at 60C, at least 3L.

title: Gouda
text: Stir for 5 mins

title: Gouda
text:
Let sit for 5 mins

prepare some non-chlorinated water at 60C, at least 3L.

title: Gouda
section: Using a sieve, ladle out 4 cups (1L) of whey
text:
Using a sieve, ladle out 4 cups (1L) of whey

sieve keeps the curds out of the cup.

title: Gouda
text:
Replace 4 cups of 60C water

target temp is 33C.

title: Gouda
text: Stir gently for 10 mins

title: Gouda
text:
Let settle for 5-10 mins

reduce temp of water to 45C.

title: Gouda
section: Note the level of the whey
text:
Note the level of the whey

there may be a level of curds on the side of the pot.

title: Gouda
section: Ladle out the whey to the level of the curds
text: Ladle out the whey to the level of the curds

title: Gouda
section: Stir, then add 45C water to the level that the whey was
text:
Stir, then add 45C water to the level that the whey was

temperature should be 37C

title: Gouda
text:
Stir for 20 mins

do we maintain temperature? I think yes

title: Gouda
text: Let rest for 10 mins

title: Gouda
section: Drain out the whey, putting the curds into a cheese cloth lined mold
text: Drain out the whey, putting the curds into a cheese cloth lined mold

title: Gouda
text: Press at 10kg for 30 mins

title: Gouda
section: Flip and press at 13kg for 12 hours
text: Flip and press at 13kg for 12 hours

title: Gouda
text:
Put into brine for 12 hours

flip the cheese half way through
can trim off any weird bits first

title: Gouda
section: Air dry on bamboo cheese mat for 2-3 days until touch dry
text:
Air dry on bamboo cheese mat for 2-3 days until touch dry

turn at least every day

title: Gouda
text: vacuum seal

title: Gouda
section: mature at 10-12C for at least 6 weeks
text: mature at 10-12C for at least 6 weeks
